availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, attorney. Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, native. Married to Sarah L. Eginton. Father of Mary J. Eginton and Thomas M. Eginton. Attorney in Clark County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Clark County in 1850. Attorney in Clark County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Clark County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Clark County, District 2, p. 4.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester, District 2, p. 33.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester, p. 4.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport (before 1911), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #7012976, Covington Deaths, p. 585.
"Judge Charles S. Eginton (1814-1890)," Find A Grave, Memorial #58497535, accessed August 16, 2017, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/58497535.
